div.head: John Anderson. Will.
div.p:
In the name of God Amen I John Anderson of Charles County in
Potucent River planter being sick & weake but of perfect minde and memory have
thought it fit to set my worldy business in order as followeth

Itm. Forst I dou bequeath my soule to the Almighty God who have me my first
being secondly my body to the ground and thirdly I doue truly give and
bequeath unto my dear wife Mary Anderson and the child that she now goes
wihtall if it liveth all my whole personal Estate that I have in this world and
the land and plantation that I now live upon with the appointmenses there
belongng unto it after my dates in paud it is my will and pleasure that all
my personal Estate is to be equally divided between my dear wife and child
if it pleaseth the Lord that is doath and as for the plantation I now live upon
if my child liveth then after the deth of my dear wife then it shall enjoy it
it if bee mayle or female and see to
and if the child should should dyethen all the personal Estate to fall to my dear
wife for wer more it is my will and pleasure that if the child thereth dear
as my dear wife nomaimith all that she may have the whole of the
Estate but when she maryes then if the man that she shall marieth shall
wayes bee awaye or consume the Estate then the appointed overseers shall
away the child Estate and of he shall any wayes above the Child they shall take
the child Estate and his Estate and if he shall any wayes above the Child they shall take
my well and pleasure that the Child should bee brought up to living- in the
fear of the Lord I dsire and trust and appoint my to well beloved friends to
look carefully after this my will to see it houly performed in all
whereforth forever. I doue Mr. William Jenkins and my dear brother
Robert Dent given under my hand and seal this first day march anno
thousand six hundred seventy and five.

On the back of the foregoing was the following Endorsement to wit
William Head and Henry Norman both witnesses of the said will and Both
sumon before me this seventeenth day of July in the year 1676.
Willm. Groome

Mary Anderson The Executor swrone before ths 17th July in the
year 1676.
4 sides.
Willm. Groome
